info.title: Purchase Order Submission API V2
info.description:
The Purchase Order API provides the ability to submit a purchase order to Dell. Customers can submit their purchase order in XML or JSON format and will receive response regarding the processing of successful or failed PO. In case of failure, response will provide appropriate message for rectifying the error.

Versions Available

To use the latest version of the API, a version number can be provided in the request header (Accepts-version). It is mandatory to provide API version in request header

A new version will be created each time a significant update is made to the schema.

| Version | Description                                         | Date Available    |
| ------- |:---------------------------------------------------:| -----------------:|
|   1.0   | Initial and first version of the Purchase Order API | 2nd Feb 2020      |
|   2.0   | Second Version of PO API with Enhancements	        | 		    |


### Request URL

| Version | Input Request format | URL	                                                                    |
| ------- |:--------------------:| ------------------------------------------------------------------------:|
|   2.0   | Json	         | https://apigtwb2c.us.dell.com/PROD/procurement/purchase-order            |
|   2.0   | Xml	                 | https://apigtwb2c.us.dell.com/PROD/procurement/xml-purchase-order        |

Within this URL PROD refers to the environment, however after your GIA has enabled your integration for live orders, the IsTestPayload flag in the payload must be set to FALSE for purchase orders to be submitted for fulfillment
 
 
### API Authentication
You will need to retrieve an authorization token to be able to send requests to the API endpoints.
The response to each request will be sent in JSON format.

POST https://apigtwb2c.us.dell.com/auth/oauth/v2/token


### Request Body

| Field           | Description                                                            | Datatype            |
| --------------- |:----------------------------------------------------------------------:| -------------------:|
|  grant_type     |  client_credentials                                                    |  string             |
|  client_id      |  The application id assigned to your app.               	           |  string             |
|  client_secret  |  The application secret created for your app under Keys. The client_secret should be URL-encoded before being sent.              |  string             |


Example Request
```
POST /auth/oauth/v2/token HTTP/1.1
Host: apigtwb2c.us.dell.com
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
User-Agent: PostmanRuntime/7.15.0
Accept: */*
Cache-Control: no-cache
accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Connection: keep-alive

grant_type=client_credentials
&client_id=testClientId
&client_secret=testClientSecret
```

Example Response
```
    {
        "access_token": "abcdef-4c9c-42dc-a756-68a8c4uvwxyz",
        "token_type": "Bearer",
        "expires_in": 3600,
        "scope": "oob"
    }
```

Once the token is retrieved from the response above, it is valid for next 60 minutes. The token can be used in subsequent requests to retrieve data from the API described below.

Token is populated in header as follows: 

```
'Authorization: Bearer 0d41a083-8d55-4cec-a4a7-22e3dc370d80' 
```

Example curl request to illustrate usage: 

```
curl --location --request POST 'https://apigtwb2c.us.dell.com/PROD/procurement/purchase-order' 
\ --header 'Authorization: Bearer 0d41a083-8d55-4cec-a4a7-22e3dc370d80' \ --header 'Accepts-version: 2.0' \ --header 'Content-Type: application/json'
```

StatusMessage: We received your Purchase Order, and it is being processed. You will be contacted if there is any issue processing the PO

value.Title: One or more validation errors occurred.

StatusMessage: Invalid item list in PO request.

Sample.value:
<PurchaseOrderResponseV2 xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
    <CorrelationId>c2b708a8-8543-45ac-8fcb-d240b2d206c1</CorrelationId>
    <ThreadId />
    <PoNumber>TestDoNotBook_Demo</PoNumber>
    <PoDate />
    <StatusCode>202</StatusCode>
    <StatusMessage>
        <string>We received your Purchase Order, and it is being processed. You will be contacted if there is any issue processing the PO</string>
    </StatusMessage>
</PurchaseOrderResponseV2>

<problem xmlns="urn:ietf:rfc:7807">
    <status>400</status>
    <title>One or more validation errors occurred.</title>
    <type>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1</type>
    <traceId>|d00cfc4e-40816ff06012219a.</traceId>
    <MVC-Errors>
        <OrderDetails_x005B_0_x005D_.Quantity>Quantity must be greater than zero Enter numeric value for Quantity</OrderDetails_x005B_0_x005D_.Quantity>
    </MVC-Errors>
</problem>
